title: Thresh Gods, please tip me <3
body:
So I've spammed the hell out of blitz and nami in sup, now I wan't to start playing {{champion:412}} and get the most out of his tool kit.

Any good tips anyone can give me when playing thresh support? Good builds? Runes/masteries? Play style etc.

Many thanks xD

replies.body:
Thresh is RANGED so he will not execute minions with {{item:3302}}  you have to last hit them properly. To make is easier, you can save your Flay passive for the bonus damage when autoing minions.
If you can't get it down, its fine just to start {{item:3301}} instead.

Max Q then W then E.
Don't level an ability until you are sure the enemy won't invade. An enemy invade can be easily countered if you take a lantern.
Usually you want to start E (as it increases your auto damage with the passive) then get Q level 2 (W level 3).

You max Q first for the CD. You max W 2nd for the CD (and collect souls to increase the shield).
Your E CD doesn't change with level and the mana goes up so leveling it last is fine. The passive E damage also scales with Souls so you don't need to max it to increase it damage, just collect souls.

You can pump fake your Q's. So walk towards/face one champ and throw your hook at a different champion. Can throw people off.
If your enemy laner are standing behind range minions, you can walk up to the wave and flay backwards. This will push the minions behind you and allow a "free" hook.

I like to run AD Marks, HP Seals, MR glyphs and Armour Quints. AD quints are also acceptable if you run Armour Seals. You just want the AD as Thresh is really good at auto harass in lane.

You can either go Thunderlords or Bond of Stone.

As the for the build. Just supporty/tank items depending on the game. He's a good roaming supp so tier 2 boots and Sightstone should be your first 2 items.

His play style is pretty versatile and also dependant on which adc and jungler you have, works really well with laners like Caitlyn and jinx who like to overextend for poke also works great for zoning any melee supports like Leo Ali and braum, but as soon as you miss a hook you lose a lot of pressure in the lane for the next 13 seconds or so, so you're better off using your hook reactively rather than as an engaging tool as is it quite a slow skill shot and pretty predictable

I play Thresh Differently (hence my build) I prefer playing tank with 3-4K health who soaks and pulls, pros play semi high health but more practical items, As mentioned before depends on your strategy and play style, Try both or make your own build which suits you and see which one you feel comfortable playing  with :)
